data: Go to osteoporosis r/osteoporosis • Miss_Beh4ve Português (Brasil) Français Română Filipino Norsk (Bokmål) 한국어 Ελληνικά Nederlands ไทย Polski Regarding osteoporosis / osteopenia, what are you working on with your physical therapist and why did you or they choose your routine? I had originally requested to do the LIFTMOR protocol because it has been shown to increase bone density, but my PT sold me on doing Stronglifts 5x5 with some added jumps instead. For comparison: LIFTMOR has… jumps barbell squats barbell deadlifts barbell overhead presses LIFTMOR study: https://onlinelibrary.wiley.com/doi/full/10.1002/jbmr.3284 LIFTMOR demonstration video: https://youtu.be/zkLPFZV43r8?si=Pr2S823ZX_II3c9y Stronglifts 5x5 has… barbell squats barbell deadlifts barbell overhead presses barbell rows barbell bench presses My PT’s rational for teaching me Stronglifts 5x5 was that the additional 2 lifts provide for strengthening of additional muscle groups, and if done with the same intensity (80-85% of 1 rep max) should also increase density in the bones involved. I’ve added some jumps to the Stronglifts 5x5 routine for impact. Would love to hear what routines others are working on with their PTs, and why the PT or you picked those exercises? Also, if you have success stories of BMD increases (or non-BMD related achievements) please share! Read more Share
